11456          return buffer.toString();
11457        }
11458      }
11459
11460      if (byteRead == '\n')
11461      {
11462        return buffer.toString();
11463      }
11464      else if (byteRead == '\r')
11465      {
11466        final int nextByteRead = in.read();
11467        Validator.ensureTrue(((nextByteRead < 0) || (nextByteRead == '\n')),
11468             "ERROR:  Read a carriage return from standard input that was " +
11469                  "not followed by a new line.");
11470        return buffer.toString();
11471      }
11472      else
11473      {
11474        buffer.append((byte) (byteRead & 0xFF));
11475      }
11476    }
11477  }
11478
11479
11480
11481  /**
11482   * Retrieves the password needed to access the private key.
11483   *
11484   * @param  keystore          The keystore that contains the target private
11485   *                           key.  This must not be {@code null}.
11486   * @param  alias             The alias of the target private key.  This must
11487   *                           not be {@code null}.
11488   * @param  keystorePassword  The keystore password to use if no specific
11489   *                           private key password was provided.
11490   *
11491   * @return  The password needed to access the private key, or the provided
11492   *          keystore password if no arguments were provided to specify a
11493   *          different private key password.
11494   *
11495   * @throws  LDAPException  If a problem is encountered while trying to get the
11496   *                         private key password.
11497   */
11498  @Nullable()
11499  private char[] getPrivateKeyPassword(@NotNull final KeyStore keystore,
11500                                       @NotNull final String alias,
11501                                       @Nullable final char[] keystorePassword)
11502          throws LDAPException
11503  {
11504    return getPrivateKeyPassword(keystore, alias, null, keystorePassword);
11505  }
11506
11507
11508
11509  /**
11510   * Retrieves the password needed to access the private key.
11511   *
11512   * @param  keystore          The keystore that contains the target private
11513   *                           key.  This must not be {@code null}.
11514   * @param  alias             The alias of the target private key.  This must
11515   *                           not be {@code null}.
11516   * @param  prefix            The prefix string to use for the arguments.  This
11517   *                           may be {@code null} if no prefix is needed.
11518   * @param  keystorePassword  The keystore password to use if no specific
11519   *                           private key password was provided.
11520   *
11521   * @return  The password needed to access the private key, or the provided
11522   *          keystore password if no arguments were provided to specify a
11523   *          different private key password.
11524   *
11525   * @throws  LDAPException  If a problem is encountered while trying to get the
11526   *                         private key password.
11527   */
11528  @Nullable()
11529  private char[] getPrivateKeyPassword(@NotNull final KeyStore keystore,
11530                                       @NotNull final String alias,
11531                                       @Nullable final String prefix,
11532                                       @Nullable final char[] keystorePassword)
11533          throws LDAPException
11534  {
11535    final String prefixDash;
11536    if (prefix == null)
11537    {
11538      prefixDash = "";
11539    }
11540    else
11541    {
11542      prefixDash = prefix + '-';
11543    }
11544
11545    final StringArgument privateKeyPasswordArgument =
11546         subCommandParser.getStringArgument(
11547              prefixDash + "private-key-password");
11548    if ((privateKeyPasswordArgument != null) &&
11549         privateKeyPasswordArgument.isPresent())
11550    {
11551      final char[] pkPasswordChars =
11552           privateKeyPasswordArgument.getValue().toCharArray();
11553      if ((pkPasswordChars.length < 6) &&
11554          (! (hasCertificateAlias(keystore, alias) ||
11555              hasKeyAlias(keystore, alias))))
11556      {
11557        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
11558             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_TOO_SHORT.get());
11559      }
11560
11561      return pkPasswordChars;
11562    }
11563
11564
11565    final FileArgument privateKeyPasswordFileArgument =
11566         subCommandParser.getFileArgument(
11567              prefixDash + "private-key-password-file");
11568    if ((privateKeyPasswordFileArgument != null) &&
11569        privateKeyPasswordFileArgument.isPresent())
11570    {
11571      final File f = privateKeyPasswordFileArgument.getValue();
11572      try
11573      {
11574        final char[] passwordChars = getPasswordFileReader().readPassword(f);
11575        if (passwordChars.length < 6)
11576        {
11577          throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
11578               ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_EMPTY_FILE.get(f.getAbsolutePath()));
11579        }
11580
11581        return passwordChars;
11582      }
11583      catch (final LDAPException e)
11584      {
11585        Debug.debugException(e);
11586        throw e;
11587      }
11588      catch (final Exception e)
11589      {
11590        Debug.debugException(e);
11591        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
11592             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_ERROR_READING_FILE.get(
11593                  f.getAbsolutePath(), StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
11594             e);
11595      }
11596    }
11597
11598
11599    final BooleanArgument promptArgument =
11600         subCommandParser.getBooleanArgument(
11601              "prompt-for-" + prefixDash + "private-key-password");
11602    if ((promptArgument != null) && promptArgument.isPresent())
11603    {
11604      out();
11605
11606      try
11607      {
11608        if ((hasKeyAlias(keystore, alias) ||
11609             hasCertificateAlias(keystore, alias)) &&
11610            (! "new".equals(prefix)) && (! "destination".equals(prefix)))
11611        {
11612          // This means that the private key already exists, so we just need to
11613          // prompt once.
11614          final String prompt;
11615          if ("current".equals(prefix))
11616          {
11617            prompt =
11618                 INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_CURRENT_PROMPT.get(alias);
11619          }
11620          else
11621          {
11622            prompt =
11623                 INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_EXISTING_PROMPT.get(alias);
11624          }
11625
11626          return promptForPassword(prompt, false);
11627        }
11628        else
11629        {
11630          // This means that we'll be creating a new private key, so we need to
11631          // prompt twice.
11632          while (true)
11633          {
11634            final String prompt;
11635            if ("new".equals(prefix))
11636            {
11637              prompt = INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_NEW_PROMPT.get();
11638            }
11639            else
11640            {
11641              prompt = INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_NEW_PROMPT_1.get(alias);
11642            }
11643
11644            final char[] pwChars = promptForPassword(prompt, false);
11645            if (pwChars.length < 6)
11646            {
11647              wrapErr(0, WRAP_COLUMN,
11648                   ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_TOO_SHORT.get());
11649              err();
11650              continue;
11651            }
11652
11653            final char[] confirmChars = promptForPassword(
11654                 INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_NEW_PROMPT_2.get(), true);
11655
11656            if (Arrays.equals(pwChars, confirmChars))
11657            {
11658              Arrays.fill(confirmChars, '\u0000');
11659              return pwChars;
11660            }
11661            else
11662            {
11663              wrapErr(0, WRAP_COLUMN,
11664                   ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_PROMPT_MISMATCH.get());
11665              err();
11666            }
11667          }
11668        }
11669      }
11670      catch (final LDAPException le)
11671      {
11672        Debug.debugException(le);
11673        throw le;
11674      }
11675      catch (final Exception e)
11676      {
11677        Debug.debugException(e);
11678        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
11679             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_PK_PW_PROMPT_ERROR.get(alias,
11680                  StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
11681             e);
11682      }
11683    }
11684
11685
11686    return keystorePassword;
11687  }
11688
11689
11690
11691  /**
11692   * Infers the keystore type from the provided keystore file.
11693   *
11694   * @param  keystorePath  The path to the file to examine.
11695   *
11696   * @return  The keystore type inferred from the provided keystore file.
11697   *
11698   * @throws  LDAPException  If a problem is encountered while trying to infer
11699   *                         the keystore type.
11700   */
11701  @NotNull()
11702  private String inferKeystoreType(@NotNull final File keystorePath)
11703          throws LDAPException
11704  {
11705    return inferKeystoreType(keystorePath, null);
11706  }
11707
11708
11709
11710  /**
11711   * Infers the keystore type from the provided keystore file.
11712   *
11713   * @param  keystorePath  The path to the file to examine.
11714   * @param  prefix        The prefix string to use for the arguments.  This
11715   *                       may be {@code null} if no prefix is needed.
11716   *
11717   * @return  The keystore type inferred from the provided keystore file.
11718   *
11719   * @throws  LDAPException  If a problem is encountered while trying to infer
11720   *                         the keystore type.
11721   */
11722  @NotNull()
11723  private String inferKeystoreType(@NotNull final File keystorePath,
11724                                   @Nullable final String prefix)
11725          throws LDAPException
11726  {
11727    // If the keystore type argument was specified, then use its value.
11728    final StringArgument keystoreTypeArgument;
11729    if (prefix == null)
11730    {
11731      keystoreTypeArgument =
11732           subCommandParser.getStringArgument("keystore-type");
11733    }
11734    else
11735    {
11736      keystoreTypeArgument =
11737           subCommandParser.getStringArgument(prefix + "-keystore-type");
11738    }
11739
11740    if ((keystoreTypeArgument != null) && keystoreTypeArgument.isPresent())
11741    {
11742      final String ktaValue = keystoreTypeArgument.getValue();
11743      if (ktaValue.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS11") ||
11744          ktaValue.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS 11") ||
11745          ktaValue.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS#11") ||
11746          ktaValue.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS #11"))
11747      {
11748        return CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_PKCS_11;
11749      }
11750      else if (ktaValue.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS12") ||
11751          ktaValue.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS 12") ||
11752          ktaValue.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS#12") ||
11753          ktaValue.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS #12"))
11754      {
11755        return CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_PKCS_12;
11756      }
11757      else if (ktaValue.equalsIgnoreCase(BCFKS_KEYSTORE_TYPE))
11758      {
11759        return BCFKS_KEYSTORE_TYPE;
11760      }
11761      else
11762      {
11763        return CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_JKS;
11764      }
11765    }
11766
11767
11768    // If we've gotten here, then the keystore type was not explicitly specified
11769    // so we will need to infer it.  If the LDAP SDK is running in FIPS mode,
11770    // then we'll always use the BCFKS key store type.
11771    if (CryptoHelper.usingFIPSMode())
11772    {
11773      return BouncyCastleFIPSHelper.FIPS_KEY_STORE_TYPE;
11774    }
11775
11776
11777    // If the key store file doesn't exist, then we must be creating it.  Use
11778    // the default key store type.
11779    if (! keystorePath.exists())
11780    {
11781      return DEFAULT_KEYSTORE_TYPE;
11782    }
11783
11784
11785    try (FileInputStream inputStream = new FileInputStream(keystorePath))
11786    {
11787      final int firstByte = inputStream.read();
11788      if (firstByte < 0)
11789      {
11790        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
11791             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_INFER_KS_TYPE_EMPTY_FILE.get(
11792                  keystorePath.getAbsolutePath()));
11793      }
11794
11795      if (firstByte == 0x30)
11796      {
11797        // This suggests that the file is encoded as a DER sequence.  This
11798        // encoding is used for both the PKCS #12 and BCFKS key stores, but we
11799        // will always assume the PKCS #12 key store type unless we're running
11800        // in FIPS mode or the keystore-type argument was provided, and both of
11801        // those cases will have already been handled.
11802        return CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_PKCS_12;
11803      }
11804      else if (firstByte == 0xFE)
11805      {
11806        // This is the correct first byte of a Java JKS keystore, which starts
11807        // with bytes 0xFEEDFEED.
11808        return CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_JKS;
11809      }
11810      else
11811      {
11812        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
11813             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_INFER_KS_TYPE_UNEXPECTED_FIRST_BYTE.get(
11814                  keystorePath.getAbsolutePath(),
11815                  StaticUtils.toHex((byte) (firstByte & 0xFF))));
11816      }
11817    }
11818    catch (final LDAPException e)
11819    {
11820      Debug.debugException(e);
11821      throw e;
11822    }
11823    catch (final Exception e)
11824    {
11825      Debug.debugException(e);
11826      throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
11827           ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_INFER_KS_TYPE_ERROR_READING_FILE.get(
11828                keystorePath.getAbsolutePath(),
11829                StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
11830           e);
11831    }
11832  }
11833
11834
11835
11836  /**
11837   * Retrieves a user-friendly representation of the provided keystore type.
11838   *
11839   * @param  keystoreType  The keystore type for which to get the user-friendly
11840   *                       name.
11841   *
11842   * @return  "JKS" if the provided keystore type is for a JKS keystore,
11843   *          "PKCS #12" if the provided keystore type is for a PKCS #12
11844   *          keystore, or the provided string if it is for some other keystore
11845   *          type.
11846   */
11847  @NotNull()
11848  static String getUserFriendlyKeystoreType(@NotNull final String keystoreType)
11849  {
11850    if (keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase("JKS"))
11851    {
11852      return "JKS";
11853    }
11854    else if (keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS11") ||
11855         keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS 11") ||
11856         keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS#11") ||
11857         keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS #11"))
11858    {
11859      return "PKCS #11";
11860    }
11861    else if (keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS12") ||
11862         keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS 12") ||
11863         keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS#12") ||
11864         keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase("PKCS #12"))
11865    {
11866      return "PKCS #12";
11867    }
11868    else if (keystoreType.equalsIgnoreCase(BCFKS_KEYSTORE_TYPE))
11869    {
11870      return BCFKS_KEYSTORE_TYPE;
11871    }
11872    else
11873    {
11874      return keystoreType;
11875    }
11876  }
11877
11878
11879
11880  /**
11881   * Gets access to a keystore based on information included in command-line
11882   * arguments.
11883   *
11884   * @param  keystoreType      The keystore type for the keystore to access.
11885   * @param  keystorePath      The path to the keystore file.
11886   * @param  keystorePassword  The password to use to access the keystore.
11887   *
11888   * @return  The configured keystore instance.
11889   *
11890   * @throws  LDAPException  If it is not possible to access the keystore.
11891   */
11892  @NotNull()
11893  static KeyStore getKeystore(@NotNull final String keystoreType,
11894                              @NotNull final File keystorePath,
11895                              @Nullable final char[] keystorePassword)
11896          throws LDAPException
11897  {
11898    // Instantiate a keystore instance of the desired keystore type.
11899    final KeyStore keystore;
11900    try
11901    {
11902      if (keystoreType.equals(CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_PKCS_11))
11903      {
11904        // NOTE:  For PKCS #11 key store types, the key store path will be
11905        // treated as the path to the provider configuration file.
11906        final Provider pkcs11Provider = PKCS11KeyManager.getProvider(null,
11907             keystorePath, keystoreType, true);
11908        keystore = CryptoHelper.getKeyStore(keystoreType, pkcs11Provider);
11909      }
11910      else if (keystoreType.equals(BCFKS_KEYSTORE_TYPE))
11911      {
11912        keystore = CryptoHelper.getKeyStore(keystoreType,
11913             BouncyCastleFIPSHelper.getBouncyCastleFIPSProvider());
11914      }
11915      else
11916      {
11917        keystore = CryptoHelper.getKeyStore(keystoreType);
11918      }
11919    }
11920    catch (final Exception e)
11921    {
11922      Debug.debugException(e);
11923      throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
11924           ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_CANNOT_INSTANTIATE_KS_TYPE.get(keystoreType,
11925                StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
11926           e);
11927    }
11928
11929
11930    // Get an input stream that may be used to access the keystore.
11931    final InputStream inputStream;
11932    try
11933    {
11934      if (keystorePath.exists() &&
11935           (! keystoreType.equals(CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_PKCS_11)))
11936      {
11937        inputStream = new FileInputStream(keystorePath);
11938      }
11939      else
11940      {
11941        inputStream = null;
11942      }
11943    }
11944    catch (final Exception e)
11945    {
11946      Debug.debugException(e);
11947      throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
11948           ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_CANNOT_OPEN_KS_FILE_FOR_READING.get(
11949                keystorePath.getAbsolutePath(),
11950                StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
11951           e);
11952    }
11953
11954    try
11955    {
11956      keystore.load(inputStream, keystorePassword);
11957    }
11958    catch (final Exception e)
11959    {
11960      Debug.debugException(e);
11961      final Throwable cause = e.getCause();
11962      if ((e instanceof IOException) && (cause != null) &&
11963          (cause instanceof UnrecoverableKeyException) &&
11964          (keystorePassword != null))
11965      {
11966        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
11967             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_CANNOT_LOAD_KS_WRONG_PW.get(
11968                  keystorePath.getAbsolutePath()),
11969             e);
11970      }
11971      else
11972      {
11973        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
11974             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_ERROR_CANNOT_LOAD_KS.get(
11975                  keystorePath.getAbsolutePath(),
11976                  StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
11977             e);
11978      }
11979    }
11980    finally
11981    {
11982      try
11983      {
11984        if (inputStream != null)
11985        {
11986          inputStream.close();
11987        }
11988      }
11989      catch (final Exception e)
11990      {
11991        Debug.debugException(e);
11992      }
11993    }
11994
11995    return keystore;
11996  }
11997
11998
11999
12000  /**
12001   * Reads all of the certificates contained in the specified file.  The file
12002   * must exist and may contain zero or more certificates that are either all in
12003   * PEM format or all in DER format.
12004   *
12005   * @param  f  The path to the certificate file to read.  It must not be
12006   *            {@code null}.
12007   *
12008   * @return  A list of the certificates read from the specified file.
12009   *
12010   * @throws  LDAPException  If a problem is encountered while reading
12011   *                         certificates from the specified file.
12012   */
12013  @NotNull()
12014  public static List<X509Certificate> readCertificatesFromFile(
12015                                           @NotNull final File f)
12016         throws LDAPException
12017  {
12018    // Read the first byte of the file to see if it contains DER-formatted data,
12019    // which we can determine by seeing if the first byte is 0x30.
12020    try (BufferedInputStream inputStream =
12021              new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(f)))
12022    {
12023      inputStream.mark(1);
12024      final int firstByte = inputStream.read();
12025
12026      if (firstByte < 0)
12027      {
12028        // This means that the file is empty.
12029        return Collections.emptyList();
12030      }
12031      else
12032      {
12033        inputStream.reset();
12034      }
12035
12036      final ArrayList<X509Certificate> certList = new ArrayList<>(5);
12037      if ((firstByte & 0xFF) == 0x30)
12038      {
12039        // It is a DER-encoded file.  Read ASN.1 elements and decode them as
12040        // X.509 certificates.
12041        while (true)
12042        {
12043          final ASN1Element certElement;
12044          try
12045          {
12046            certElement = ASN1Element.readFrom(inputStream);
12047          }
12048          catch (final Exception e)
12049          {
12050            Debug.debugException(e);
12051            throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
12052                 ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CERTS_FROM_FILE_DER_NOT_VALID_ASN1.get(
12053                      f.getAbsolutePath(), StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12054                 e);
12055          }
12056
12057          if (certElement == null)
12058          {
12059            // We've reached the end of the input stream.
12060            return certList;
12061          }
12062
12063          try
12064          {
12065            certList.add(new X509Certificate(certElement.encode()));
12066          }
12067          catch (final CertException e)
12068          {
12069            Debug.debugException(e);
12070            throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12071                 ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CERTS_FROM_FILE_DER_NOT_VALID_CERT.get(
12072                      f.getAbsolutePath(), e.getMessage()),
12073                 e);
12074          }
12075        }
12076      }
12077      else
12078      {
12079        try (BufferedReader reader =
12080                  new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(inputStream)))
12081        {
12082          boolean inCert = false;
12083          final StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder();
12084          while (true)
12085          {
12086            String line = reader.readLine();
12087            if (line == null)
12088            {
12089              if (inCert)
12090              {
12091                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12092                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CERTS_FROM_FILE_EOF_WITHOUT_END.get(
12093                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12094              }
12095
12096              return certList;
12097            }
12098
12099            line = line.trim();
12100            if (line.isEmpty() || line.startsWith("#"))
12101            {
12102              continue;
12103            }
12104
12105            if (line.equals("-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----"))
12106            {
12107              if (inCert)
12108              {
12109                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12110                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CERTS_FROM_FILE_MULTIPLE_BEGIN.get(
12111                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12112              }
12113              else
12114              {
12115                inCert = true;
12116              }
12117            }
12118            else if (line.equals("-----END CERTIFICATE-----"))
12119            {
12120              if (! inCert)
12121              {
12122                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12123                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CERTS_FROM_FILE_END_WITHOUT_BEGIN.
12124                          get(f.getAbsolutePath()));
12125              }
12126
12127              inCert = false;
12128              final byte[] certBytes;
12129              try
12130              {
12131                certBytes = Base64.decode(buffer.toString());
12132              }
12133              catch (final Exception e)
12134              {
12135                Debug.debugException(e);
12136                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12137                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CERTS_FROM_FILE_PEM_CERT_NOT_BASE64.
12138                          get(f.getAbsolutePath(),
12139                               StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12140                     e);
12141              }
12142
12143              try
12144              {
12145                certList.add(new X509Certificate(certBytes));
12146              }
12147              catch (final CertException e)
12148              {
12149                Debug.debugException(e);
12150                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12151                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CERTS_FROM_FILE_PEM_CERT_NOT_CERT.
12152                          get(f.getAbsolutePath(), e.getMessage()),
12153                     e);
12154              }
12155
12156              buffer.setLength(0);
12157            }
12158            else if (inCert)
12159            {
12160              buffer.append(line);
12161            }
12162            else
12163            {
12164              throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12165                   ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CERTS_FROM_FILE_DATA_WITHOUT_BEGIN.get(
12166                        f.getAbsolutePath()));
12167            }
12168          }
12169        }
12170      }
12171    }
12172    catch (final LDAPException le)
12173    {
12174      Debug.debugException(le);
12175      throw le;
12176    }
12177    catch (final Exception e)
12178    {
12179      Debug.debugException(e);
12180      throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
12181           ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CERTS_FROM_FILE_READ_ERROR.get(
12182                f.getAbsolutePath(), StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12183           e);
12184    }
12185  }
12186
12187
12188
12189  /**
12190   * Reads a private key from the specified file.  The file must exist and must
12191   * contain exactly one PEM-encoded or DER-encoded PKCS #8 private key.
12192   *
12193   * @param  f  The path to the private key file to read.  It must not be
12194   *            {@code null}.
12195   *
12196   * @return  The private key read from the file.
12197   *
12198   * @throws  LDAPException  If a problem is encountered while reading the
12199   *                         private key.
12200   */
12201  @NotNull()
12202  static PKCS8PrivateKey readPrivateKeyFromFile(@NotNull final File f)
12203         throws LDAPException
12204  {
12205    // Read the first byte of the file to see if it contains DER-formatted data,
12206    // which we can determine by seeing if the first byte is 0x30.
12207    try (BufferedInputStream inputStream =
12208              new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(f)))
12209    {
12210      inputStream.mark(1);
12211      final int firstByte = inputStream.read();
12212
12213      if (firstByte < 0)
12214      {
12215        // This means that the file is empty.
12216        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12217             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_EMPTY_FILE.get(
12218                  f.getAbsolutePath()));
12219      }
12220      else
12221      {
12222        inputStream.reset();
12223      }
12224
12225      PKCS8PrivateKey privateKey = null;
12226      if ((firstByte & 0xFF) == 0x30)
12227      {
12228        // It is a DER-encoded file.  Read an ASN.1 element and decode it as a
12229        // certificate.
12230        while (true)
12231        {
12232          final ASN1Element pkElement;
12233          try
12234          {
12235            pkElement = ASN1Element.readFrom(inputStream);
12236          }
12237          catch (final Exception e)
12238          {
12239            Debug.debugException(e);
12240            throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
12241                 ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_DER_NOT_VALID_ASN1.get(
12242                      f.getAbsolutePath(), StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12243                 e);
12244          }
12245
12246          if (pkElement == null)
12247          {
12248            // We've reached the end of the input stream.
12249            if (privateKey == null)
12250            {
12251              throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12252                   ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_EMPTY_FILE.get(
12253                        f.getAbsolutePath()));
12254            }
12255            else
12256            {
12257              return privateKey;
12258            }
12259          }
12260          else if (privateKey == null)
12261          {
12262            try
12263            {
12264              privateKey = new PKCS8PrivateKey(pkElement.encode());
12265            }
12266            catch (final Exception e)
12267            {
12268              Debug.debugException(e);
12269              throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12270                   ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_DER_NOT_VALID_PK.get(
12271                        f.getAbsolutePath(), e.getMessage()),
12272                   e);
12273            }
12274          }
12275          else
12276          {
12277            throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12278                 ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_MULTIPLE_KEYS.get(
12279                      f.getAbsolutePath()));
12280          }
12281        }
12282      }
12283      else
12284      {
12285        try (BufferedReader reader =
12286                  new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(inputStream)))
12287        {
12288          boolean inKey = false;
12289          boolean isRSAKey = false;
12290          final StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder();
12291          while (true)
12292          {
12293            String line = reader.readLine();
12294            if (line == null)
12295            {
12296              if (inKey)
12297              {
12298                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12299                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_EOF_WITHOUT_END.get(
12300                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12301              }
12302
12303              if (privateKey == null)
12304              {
12305                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12306                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_EMPTY_FILE.get(
12307                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12308              }
12309              else
12310              {
12311                return privateKey;
12312              }
12313            }
12314
12315            line = line.trim();
12316            if (line.isEmpty() || line.startsWith("#"))
12317            {
12318              continue;
12319            }
12320
12321            if (line.equals("-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----") ||
12322                 line.equals("-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"))
12323            {
12324              if (inKey)
12325              {
12326                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12327                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_MULTIPLE_BEGIN.get(
12328                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12329              }
12330              else if (privateKey != null)
12331              {
12332                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12333                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_MULTIPLE_KEYS.get(
12334                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12335              }
12336              else
12337              {
12338                inKey = true;
12339                if (line.equals("-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"))
12340                {
12341                  isRSAKey = true;
12342                }
12343              }
12344            }
12345            else if (line.equals("-----END PRIVATE KEY-----") ||
12346                 line.equals("-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"))
12347            {
12348              if (! inKey)
12349              {
12350                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12351                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_END_WITHOUT_BEGIN.get(
12352                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12353              }
12354
12355              inKey = false;
12356              byte[] pkBytes;
12357              try
12358              {
12359                pkBytes = Base64.decode(buffer.toString());
12360              }
12361              catch (final Exception e)
12362              {
12363                Debug.debugException(e);
12364                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12365                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_PEM_PK_NOT_BASE64.get(
12366                          f.getAbsolutePath(),
12367                          StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12368                     e);
12369              }
12370
12371              if (isRSAKey)
12372              {
12373                pkBytes = PKCS8PrivateKey.wrapRSAPrivateKey(pkBytes);
12374              }
12375
12376              try
12377              {
12378                privateKey = new PKCS8PrivateKey(pkBytes);
12379              }
12380              catch (final CertException e)
12381              {
12382                Debug.debugException(e);
12383                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12384                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_PEM_PK_NOT_PK.get(
12385                          f.getAbsolutePath(), e.getMessage()),
12386                     e);
12387              }
12388
12389              buffer.setLength(0);
12390            }
12391            else if (inKey)
12392            {
12393              buffer.append(line);
12394            }
12395            else
12396            {
12397              throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12398                   ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_DATA_WITHOUT_BEGIN.get(
12399                        f.getAbsolutePath()));
12400            }
12401          }
12402        }
12403      }
12404    }
12405    catch (final LDAPException le)
12406    {
12407      Debug.debugException(le);
12408      throw le;
12409    }
12410    catch (final Exception e)
12411    {
12412      Debug.debugException(e);
12413      throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
12414           ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_PK_FROM_FILE_READ_ERROR.get(
12415                f.getAbsolutePath(), StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12416           e);
12417    }
12418  }
12419
12420
12421
12422  /**
12423   * Reads a certificate signing request from the specified file.  The file must
12424   * exist and must contain exactly one PEM-encoded or DER-encoded PKCS #10
12425   * certificate signing request.
12426   *
12427   * @param  f  The path to the private key file to read.  It must not be
12428   *            {@code null}.
12429   *
12430   * @return  The certificate signing request read from the file.
12431   *
12432   * @throws  LDAPException  If a problem is encountered while reading the
12433   *                         certificate signing request.
12434   */
12435  @NotNull()
12436  public static PKCS10CertificateSigningRequest
12437                     readCertificateSigningRequestFromFile(
12438                          @NotNull final File f)
12439         throws LDAPException
12440  {
12441    // Read the first byte of the file to see if it contains DER-formatted data,
12442    // which we can determine by seeing if the first byte is 0x30.
12443    try (BufferedInputStream inputStream =
12444              new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(f)))
12445    {
12446      inputStream.mark(1);
12447      final int firstByte = inputStream.read();
12448
12449      if (firstByte < 0)
12450      {
12451        // This means that the file is empty.
12452        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12453             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_EMPTY_FILE.get(
12454                  f.getAbsolutePath()));
12455      }
12456      else
12457      {
12458        inputStream.reset();
12459      }
12460
12461      PKCS10CertificateSigningRequest csr = null;
12462      if ((firstByte & 0xFF) == 0x30)
12463      {
12464        // It is a DER-encoded file.  Read an ASN.1 element and decode it as a
12465        // certificate.
12466        while (true)
12467        {
12468          final ASN1Element csrElement;
12469          try
12470          {
12471            csrElement = ASN1Element.readFrom(inputStream);
12472          }
12473          catch (final Exception e)
12474          {
12475            Debug.debugException(e);
12476            throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
12477                 ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_DER_NOT_VALID_ASN1.get(
12478                      f.getAbsolutePath(), StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12479                 e);
12480          }
12481
12482          if (csrElement == null)
12483          {
12484            // We've reached the end of the input stream.
12485            if (csr == null)
12486            {
12487              throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12488                   ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_EMPTY_FILE.get(
12489                        f.getAbsolutePath()));
12490            }
12491            else
12492            {
12493              return csr;
12494            }
12495          }
12496          else if (csr == null)
12497          {
12498            try
12499            {
12500              csr = new PKCS10CertificateSigningRequest(csrElement.encode());
12501            }
12502            catch (final Exception e)
12503            {
12504              Debug.debugException(e);
12505              throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12506                   ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_DER_NOT_VALID_CSR.get(
12507                        f.getAbsolutePath(), e.getMessage()),
12508                   e);
12509            }
12510          }
12511          else
12512          {
12513            throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12514                 ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_MULTIPLE_CSRS.get(
12515                      f.getAbsolutePath()));
12516          }
12517        }
12518      }
12519      else
12520      {
12521        try (BufferedReader reader =
12522                  new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(inputStream)))
12523        {
12524          boolean inCSR = false;
12525          final StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder();
12526          while (true)
12527          {
12528            String line = reader.readLine();
12529            if (line == null)
12530            {
12531              if (inCSR)
12532              {
12533                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12534                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_EOF_WITHOUT_END.get(
12535                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12536              }
12537
12538              if (csr == null)
12539              {
12540                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12541                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_EMPTY_FILE.get(
12542                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12543              }
12544              else
12545              {
12546                return csr;
12547              }
12548            }
12549
12550            line = line.trim();
12551            if (line.isEmpty() || line.startsWith("#"))
12552            {
12553              continue;
12554            }
12555
12556            if (line.equals("-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----") ||
12557                line.equals("-----BEGIN NEW CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----"))
12558            {
12559              if (inCSR)
12560              {
12561                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12562                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_MULTIPLE_BEGIN.get(
12563                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12564              }
12565              else if (csr != null)
12566              {
12567                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12568                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_MULTIPLE_CSRS.get(
12569                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12570              }
12571              else
12572              {
12573                inCSR = true;
12574              }
12575            }
12576            else if (line.equals("-----END CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----") ||
12577                 line.equals("-----END NEW CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----"))
12578            {
12579              if (! inCSR)
12580              {
12581                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12582                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_END_WITHOUT_BEGIN.get(
12583                          f.getAbsolutePath()));
12584              }
12585
12586              inCSR = false;
12587              final byte[] csrBytes;
12588              try
12589              {
12590                csrBytes = Base64.decode(buffer.toString());
12591              }
12592              catch (final Exception e)
12593              {
12594                Debug.debugException(e);
12595                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12596                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_PEM_CSR_NOT_BASE64.get(
12597                          f.getAbsolutePath(),
12598                          StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12599                     e);
12600              }
12601
12602              try
12603              {
12604                csr = new PKCS10CertificateSigningRequest(csrBytes);
12605              }
12606              catch (final CertException e)
12607              {
12608                Debug.debugException(e);
12609                throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12610                     ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_PEM_CSR_NOT_CSR.get(
12611                          f.getAbsolutePath(), e.getMessage()),
12612                     e);
12613              }
12614
12615              buffer.setLength(0);
12616            }
12617            else if (inCSR)
12618            {
12619              buffer.append(line);
12620            }
12621            else
12622            {
12623              throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.PARAM_ERROR,
12624                   ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_DATA_WITHOUT_BEGIN.get(
12625                        f.getAbsolutePath()));
12626            }
12627          }
12628        }
12629      }
12630    }
12631    catch (final LDAPException le)
12632    {
12633      Debug.debugException(le);
12634      throw le;
12635    }
12636    catch (final Exception e)
12637    {
12638      Debug.debugException(e);
12639      throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
12640           ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_READ_CSR_FROM_FILE_READ_ERROR.get(
12641                f.getAbsolutePath(), StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12642           e);
12643    }
12644  }
12645
12646
12647
12648  /**
12649   * Retrieves a colon-delimited hexadecimal representation of the contents of
12650   * the provided byte array.
12651   *
12652   * @param  bytes  The byte array for which to get the hexadecimal
12653   *                representation.  It must not be {@code null}.
12654   *
12655   * @return  A colon-delimited hexadecimal representation of the contents of
12656   *          the provided byte array.
12657   */
12658  @NotNull()
12659  private static String toColonDelimitedHex(@NotNull final byte... bytes)
12660  {
12661    final StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder(bytes.length * 3);
12662    StaticUtils.toHex(bytes, ":", buffer);
12663    return buffer.toString();
12664  }
12665
12666
12667
12668  /**
12669   * Retrieves a formatted representation of the provided date in a
12670   * human-readable format that includes an offset from the current time.
12671   *
12672   * @param  d  The date to format.  It must not be {@code null}.
12673   *
12674   * @return  A formatted representation of the provided date.
12675   */
12676  @NotNull()
12677  private static String formatDateAndTime(@NotNull final Date d)
12678  {
12679    // Example:  Sunday, January 1, 2017
12680    final String dateFormatString = "EEEE, MMMM d, yyyy";
12681    final String formattedDate =
12682         new SimpleDateFormat(dateFormatString).format(d);
12683
12684    // Example:  12:34:56 AM CDT
12685    final String timeFormatString = "hh:mm:ss aa z";
12686    final String formattedTime =
12687         new SimpleDateFormat(timeFormatString).format(d);
12688
12689    final long providedTime = d.getTime();
12690    final long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
12691    if (providedTime > currentTime)
12692    {
12693      final long secondsInFuture = ((providedTime - currentTime) / 1000L);
12694      final String durationInFuture =
12695           StaticUtils.secondsToHumanReadableDuration(secondsInFuture);
12696      return INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_FORMAT_DATE_AND_TIME_IN_FUTURE.get(formattedDate,
12697           formattedTime, durationInFuture);
12698    }
12699    else
12700    {
12701      final long secondsInPast = ((currentTime - providedTime) / 1000L);
12702      final String durationInPast =
12703           StaticUtils.secondsToHumanReadableDuration(secondsInPast);
12704      return INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_FORMAT_DATE_AND_TIME_IN_PAST.get(formattedDate,
12705           formattedTime, durationInPast);
12706    }
12707  }
12708
12709
12710
12711  /**
12712   * Retrieves a formatted representation of the provided date in a format
12713   * suitable for use as the validity start time value provided to the keytool
12714   * command.
12715   *
12716   * @param  d  The date to format.  It must not be {@code null}.
12717   *
12718   * @return  A formatted representation of the provided date.
12719   */
12720  @NotNull()
12721  private static String formatValidityStartTime(@NotNull final Date d)
12722  {
12723    // Example:  2017/01/01 01:23:45
12724    final String dateFormatString = "yyyy'/'MM'/'dd HH':'mm':'ss";
12725    return new SimpleDateFormat(dateFormatString).format(d);
12726  }
12727
12728
12729
12730  /**
12731   * Retrieves the certificate chain for the specified certificate from the
12732   * given keystore.  If any issuer certificate is not in the provided keystore,
12733   * then the JVM-default trust store will be checked to see if it can be found
12734   * there.
12735   *
12736   * @param  alias             The alias of the certificate for which to get the
12737   *                           certificate chain.  This must not be
12738   *                           {@code null}.
12739   * @param  keystore          The keystore from which to get the certificate
12740   *                           chain.  This must not be {@code null}.
12741   * @param  missingIssuerRef  A reference that will be updated with the DN of a
12742   *                           missing issuer certificate, if any certificate in
12743   *                           the chain cannot be located.  This must not be
12744   *                           {@code null}.
12745   *
12746   * @return  The certificate chain for the specified certificate, or an empty
12747   *          array if no certificate exists with the specified alias.
12748   *
12749   * @throws  LDAPException  If a problem is encountered while getting the
12750   *                         certificate chain.
12751   */
12752  @NotNull()
12753  private static X509Certificate[] getCertificateChain(
12754                      @NotNull final String alias,
12755                      @NotNull final KeyStore keystore,
12756                      @NotNull final AtomicReference<DN> missingIssuerRef)
12757          throws LDAPException
12758  {
12759    try
12760    {
12761      // First, see if the keystore will give us the certificate chain.  This
12762      // will only happen if the alias references an entry that includes the
12763      // private key, but it will save us a lot of work.
12764      final Certificate[] chain = keystore.getCertificateChain(alias);
12765      if ((chain != null) && (chain.length > 0))
12766      {
12767        final X509Certificate[] x509Chain = new X509Certificate[chain.length];
12768        for (int i=0; i < chain.length; i++)
12769        {
12770          x509Chain[i] = new X509Certificate(chain[i].getEncoded());
12771        }
12772        return x509Chain;
12773      }
12774
12775
12776      // We couldn't get the keystore to give us the chain, but see if we can
12777      // get a certificate with the specified alias.
12778      final Certificate endCert = keystore.getCertificate(alias);
12779      if (endCert == null)
12780      {
12781        // This means there isn't any certificate with the specified alias.
12782        // Return an empty chain.
12783        return new X509Certificate[0];
12784      }
12785
12786      final ArrayList<X509Certificate> chainList = new ArrayList<>(5);
12787      X509Certificate certificate = new X509Certificate(endCert.getEncoded());
12788      chainList.add(certificate);
12789
12790      final AtomicReference<KeyStore> jvmDefaultTrustStoreRef =
12791           new AtomicReference<>();
12792      while (true)
12793      {
12794        final X509Certificate issuerCertificate =
12795             getIssuerCertificate(certificate, keystore,
12796                  jvmDefaultTrustStoreRef, missingIssuerRef);
12797        if (issuerCertificate == null)
12798        {
12799          break;
12800        }
12801
12802        chainList.add(issuerCertificate);
12803        certificate = issuerCertificate;
12804      }
12805
12806      final X509Certificate[] x509Chain = new X509Certificate[chainList.size()];
12807      return chainList.toArray(x509Chain);
12808    }
12809    catch (final Exception e)
12810    {
12811      Debug.debugException(e);
12812      throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
12813           ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_GET_CHAIN_ERROR.get(alias,
12814                StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
12815           e);
12816    }
12817  }
12818
12819
12820
12821  /**
12822   * Attempts to retrieve the issuer certificate for the provided certificate
12823   * from the given keystore or the JVM-default trust store.
12824   *
12825   * @param  certificate              The certificate for which to retrieve the
12826   *                                  issuer certificate.
12827   * @param  keystore                 The keystore in which to look for the
12828   *                                  issuer certificate.
12829   * @param  jvmDefaultTrustStoreRef  A reference that will be used to hold the
12830   *                                  JVM-default trust store if it is obtained
12831   *                                  in the process of retrieving the issuer
12832   *                                  certificate.
12833   * @param  missingIssuerRef         A reference that will be updated with the
12834   *                                  DN of a missing issuer certificate, if any
12835   *                                  certificate in the chain cannot be
12836   *                                  located.  This must not be {@code null}.
12837   *
12838   * @return  The issuer certificate for the provided certificate, or
12839   *          {@code null} if the issuer certificate could not be retrieved.
12840   *
12841   * @throws  Exception   If a problem is encountered while trying to retrieve
12842   *                      the issuer certificate.
12843   */
12844  @Nullable()
12845  private static X509Certificate getIssuerCertificate(
12846               @NotNull final X509Certificate certificate,
12847               @NotNull final KeyStore keystore,
12848               @NotNull final AtomicReference<KeyStore> jvmDefaultTrustStoreRef,
12849               @NotNull final AtomicReference<DN> missingIssuerRef)
12850          throws Exception
12851  {
12852    final DN subjectDN = certificate.getSubjectDN();
12853    final DN issuerDN = certificate.getIssuerDN();
12854    if (subjectDN.equals(issuerDN))
12855    {
12856      // This means that the certificate is self-signed, so there is no issuer.
12857      return null;
12858    }
12859
12860
12861    // See if we can find the issuer certificate in the provided keystore.
12862    X509Certificate issuerCertificate = getIssuerCertificate(certificate,
12863         keystore);
12864    if (issuerCertificate != null)
12865    {
12866      return issuerCertificate;
12867    }
12868
12869
12870    // See if we can get the JVM-default trust store.
12871    KeyStore jvmDefaultTrustStore = jvmDefaultTrustStoreRef.get();
12872    if (jvmDefaultTrustStore == null)
12873    {
12874      if (JVM_DEFAULT_CACERTS_FILE == null)
12875      {
12876        missingIssuerRef.set(issuerDN);
12877        return null;
12878      }
12879
12880      final String[] keystoreTypes =
12881      {
12882        CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_JKS,
12883        CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_PKCS_12,
12884        BouncyCastleFIPSHelper.FIPS_KEY_STORE_TYPE
12885      };
12886
12887      for (final String keystoreType : keystoreTypes)
12888      {
12889        final KeyStore ks = CryptoHelper.getKeyStore(keystoreType);
12890        try (FileInputStream inputStream =
12891                  new FileInputStream(JVM_DEFAULT_CACERTS_FILE))
12892        {
12893          ks.load(inputStream, null);
12894          jvmDefaultTrustStore = ks;
12895          jvmDefaultTrustStoreRef.set(jvmDefaultTrustStore);
12896          break;
12897        }
12898        catch (final Exception e)
12899        {
12900          Debug.debugException(e);
12901        }
12902      }
12903    }
12904
12905    if (jvmDefaultTrustStore != null)
12906    {
12907      issuerCertificate = getIssuerCertificate(certificate,
12908           jvmDefaultTrustStore);
12909    }
12910
12911    if (issuerCertificate == null)
12912    {
12913      missingIssuerRef.set(issuerDN);
12914    }
12915
12916    return issuerCertificate;
12917  }
12918
12919
12920
12921  /**
12922   * Attempts to retrieve the issuer certificate for the provided certificate
12923   * from the given keystore.
12924   *
12925   * @param  certificate  The certificate for which to retrieve the issuer
12926   *                      certificate.
12927   * @param  keystore     The keystore in which to look for the issuer
12928   *                      certificate.
12929   *
12930   * @return  The issuer certificate for the provided certificate, or
12931   *          {@code null} if the issuer certificate could not be retrieved.
12932   *
12933   * @throws  Exception   If a problem is encountered while trying to retrieve
12934   *                      the issuer certificate.
12935   */
12936  @Nullable()
12937  private static X509Certificate getIssuerCertificate(
12938                      @NotNull final X509Certificate certificate,
12939                      @NotNull final KeyStore keystore)
12940          throws Exception
12941  {
12942    final Enumeration<String> aliases = keystore.aliases();
12943    while (aliases.hasMoreElements())
12944    {
12945      final String alias = aliases.nextElement();
12946
12947      Certificate[] certs = null;
12948      if (hasCertificateAlias(keystore, alias))
12949      {
12950        final Certificate c = keystore.getCertificate(alias);
12951        if (c == null)
12952        {
12953          continue;
12954        }
12955
12956        certs = new Certificate[] { c };
12957      }
12958      else if (hasKeyAlias(keystore, alias))
12959      {
12960        certs = keystore.getCertificateChain(alias);
12961      }
12962
12963      if (certs != null)
12964      {
12965        for (final Certificate c : certs)
12966        {
12967          final X509Certificate xc = new X509Certificate(c.getEncoded());
12968          if (xc.isIssuerFor(certificate))
12969          {
12970            return xc;
12971          }
12972        }
12973      }
12974    }
12975
12976    return null;
12977  }
12978
12979
12980
12981  /**
12982   * Retrieves the authority key identifier value for the provided certificate,
12983   * if present.
12984   *
12985   * @param  c  The certificate for which to retrieve the authority key
12986   *            identifier.
12987   *
12988   * @return  The authority key identifier value for the provided certificate,
12989   *          or {@code null} if the certificate does not have an authority
12990   *          key identifier.
12991   */
12992  @Nullable()
12993  private static byte[] getAuthorityKeyIdentifier(
12994                             @NotNull final X509Certificate c)
12995  {
12996    for (final X509CertificateExtension extension : c.getExtensions())
12997    {
12998      if (extension instanceof AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension)
12999      {
13000        final AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension e =
13001             (AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension) extension;
13002        if (e.getKeyIdentifier() != null)
13003        {
13004          return e.getKeyIdentifier().getValue();
13005        }
13006      }
13007    }
13008
13009    return null;
13010  }
13011
13012
13013
13014  /**
13015   * Writes the provided keystore to the specified file.  If the keystore file
13016   * already exists, a new temporary file will be created, the old file renamed
13017   * out of the way, the new file renamed into place, and the old file deleted.
13018   * If the keystore file does not exist, then it will simply be created in the
13019   * correct place.
13020   *
13021   * @param  keystore          The keystore to be written.
13022   * @param  keystorePath      The path to the keystore file to be written.
13023   * @param  keystorePassword  The password to use for the keystore.
13024   *
13025   * @throws  LDAPException  If a problem is encountered while writing the
13026   *                         keystore.
13027   */
13028  static void writeKeystore(@NotNull final KeyStore keystore,
13029                            @NotNull final File keystorePath,
13030                            @Nullable final char[] keystorePassword)
13031          throws LDAPException
13032  {
13033    // If the key store type is PKCS #11, then we don't need to worry about a
13034    // key store file.
13035    if (keystore.getType().equals(CryptoHelper.KEY_STORE_TYPE_PKCS_11))
13036    {
13037      try
13038      {
13039        keystore.store(null);
13040        return;
13041      }
13042      catch (final Exception e)
13043      {
13044        Debug.debugException(e);
13045        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
13046             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_PKCS11_WRITE_ERROR.get(
13047                  StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
13048             e);
13049      }
13050    }
13051
13052
13053    File copyOfExistingKeystore = null;
13054    final String timestamp =
13055         StaticUtils.encodeGeneralizedTime(System.currentTimeMillis());
13056    if (keystorePath.exists())
13057    {
13058      copyOfExistingKeystore = new File(keystorePath.getAbsolutePath() +
13059           ".backup-" + timestamp);
13060      try
13061      {
13062        Files.copy(keystorePath.toPath(), copyOfExistingKeystore.toPath());
13063      }
13064      catch (final Exception e)
13065      {
13066        Debug.debugException(e);
13067        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
13068             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_WRITE_KS_ERROR_COPYING_EXISTING_KS.get(
13069                  keystorePath.getAbsolutePath(),
13070                  copyOfExistingKeystore.getAbsolutePath(),
13071                  StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
13072             e);
13073      }
13074    }
13075
13076    try (FileOutputStream outputStream = new FileOutputStream(keystorePath))
13077    {
13078      keystore.store(outputStream, keystorePassword);
13079    }
13080    catch (final Exception e)
13081    {
13082      Debug.debugException(e);
13083      if (copyOfExistingKeystore == null)
13084      {
13085        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
13086             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_WRITE_KS_ERROR_WRITING_NEW_KS.get(
13087                  keystorePath.getAbsolutePath(),
13088                  StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
13089             e);
13090      }
13091      else
13092      {
13093        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
13094             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_WRITE_KS_ERROR_OVERWRITING_KS.get(
13095                  keystorePath.getAbsolutePath(),
13096                  StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e),
13097                  copyOfExistingKeystore.getAbsolutePath()),
13098             e);
13099      }
13100    }
13101
13102    if (copyOfExistingKeystore != null)
13103    {
13104      try
13105      {
13106        Files.delete(copyOfExistingKeystore.toPath());
13107      }
13108      catch (final Exception e)
13109      {
13110        Debug.debugException(e);
13111        throw new LDAPException(ResultCode.LOCAL_ERROR,
13112             ERR_MANAGE_CERTS_WRITE_KS_ERROR_DELETING_KS_BACKUP.get(
13113                  copyOfExistingKeystore.getAbsolutePath(),
13114                  keystorePath.getAbsolutePath(),
13115                  StaticUtils.getExceptionMessage(e)),
13116             e);
13117      }
13118    }
13119  }
13120
13121
13122
13123  /**
13124   * Indicates whether the provided keystore has a certificate entry with the
13125   * specified alias.
13126   *
13127   * @param  keystore  The keystore to examine.
13128   * @param  alias     The alias for which to make the determination.
13129   *
13130   * @return  {@code true} if the keystore has a certificate entry with the
13131   *          specified alias, or {@code false} if the alias doesn't exist or
13132   *          is associated with some other type of entry (like a key).
13133   */
13134  private static boolean hasCertificateAlias(@NotNull final KeyStore keystore,
13135                                             @NotNull final String alias)
13136  {
13137    try
13138    {
13139      return keystore.isCertificateEntry(alias);
13140    }
13141    catch (final Exception e)
13142    {
13143      // This should never happen.  If it does, then we'll assume the alias
13144      // doesn't exist or isn't associated with a certificate.
13145      Debug.debugException(e);
13146      return false;
13147    }
13148  }
13149
13150
13151
13152  /**
13153   * Indicates whether the provided keystore has a key entry with the specified
13154   * alias.
13155   *
13156   * @param  keystore  The keystore to examine.
13157   * @param  alias     The alias for which to make the determination.
13158   *
13159   * @return  {@code true} if the keystore has a key entry with the specified
13160   *          alias, or {@code false} if the alias doesn't exist or is
13161   *          associated with some other type of entry (like a certificate).
13162   */
13163  private static boolean hasKeyAlias(@NotNull final KeyStore keystore,
13164                                     @NotNull final String alias)
13165  {
13166    try
13167    {
13168      return keystore.isKeyEntry(alias);
13169    }
13170    catch (final Exception e)
13171    {
13172      // This should never happen.  If it does, then we'll assume the alias
13173      // doesn't exist or isn't associated with a key.
13174      Debug.debugException(e);
13175      return false;
13176    }
13177  }
13178
13179
13180
13181  /**
13182   * Adds arguments for each of the provided extensions to the given list.
13183   *
13184   * @param  keytoolArguments   The list to which the extension arguments should
13185   *                            be added.
13186   * @param  basicConstraints   The basic constraints extension to include.  It
13187   *                            may be {@code null} if this extension should not
13188   *                            be included.
13189   * @param  keyUsage           The key usage extension to include.  It may be
13190   *                            {@code null} if this extension should not be
13191   *                            included.
13192   * @param  extendedKeyUsage   The extended key usage extension to include.  It
13193   *                            may be {@code null} if this extension should not
13194   *                            be included.
13195   * @param  sanValues          The list of subject alternative name values to
13196   *                            include.  It must not be {@code null} but may be
13197   *                            empty.
13198   * @param  ianValues          The list of issuer alternative name values to
13199   *                            include.  It must not be {@code null} but may be
13200   *                            empty.
13201   * @param  genericExtensions  The list of generic extensions to include.  It
13202   *                            must not be {@code null} but may be empty.
13203   */
13204  private static void addExtensionArguments(
13205               @NotNull final List<String> keytoolArguments,
13206               @Nullable final BasicConstraintsExtension basicConstraints,
13207               @Nullable final KeyUsageExtension keyUsage,
13208               @Nullable final ExtendedKeyUsageExtension extendedKeyUsage,
13209               @NotNull final Set<String> sanValues,
13210               @NotNull final Set<String> ianValues,
13211               @NotNull final List<X509CertificateExtension> genericExtensions)
13212  {
13213    if (basicConstraints != null)
13214    {
13215      final StringBuilder basicConstraintsValue = new StringBuilder();
13216      basicConstraintsValue.append("ca:");
13217      basicConstraintsValue.append(basicConstraints.isCA());
13218
13219      if (basicConstraints.getPathLengthConstraint() != null)
13220      {
13221        basicConstraintsValue.append(",pathlen:");
13222        basicConstraintsValue.append(
13223             basicConstraints.getPathLengthConstraint());
13224      }
13225
13226      keytoolArguments.add("-ext");
13227      keytoolArguments.add("BasicConstraints=" + basicConstraintsValue);
13228    }
13229
13230    if (keyUsage != null)
13231    {
13232      final StringBuilder keyUsageValue = new StringBuilder();
13233      if (keyUsage.isDigitalSignatureBitSet())
13234      {
13235        commaAppend(keyUsageValue, "digitalSignature");
13236      }
13237
13238      if (keyUsage.isNonRepudiationBitSet())
13239      {
13240        commaAppend(keyUsageValue, "nonRepudiation");
13241      }
13242
13243      if (keyUsage.isKeyEnciphermentBitSet())
13244      {
13245        commaAppend(keyUsageValue, "keyEncipherment");
13246      }
13247
13248      if (keyUsage.isDataEnciphermentBitSet())
13249      {
13250        commaAppend(keyUsageValue, "dataEncipherment");
13251      }
13252
13253      if (keyUsage.isKeyAgreementBitSet())
13254      {
13255        commaAppend(keyUsageValue, "keyAgreement");
13256      }
13257
13258      if (keyUsage.isKeyCertSignBitSet())
13259      {
13260        commaAppend(keyUsageValue, "keyCertSign");
13261      }
13262
13263      if (keyUsage.isCRLSignBitSet())
13264      {
13265        commaAppend(keyUsageValue, "cRLSign");
13266      }
13267
13268      if (keyUsage.isEncipherOnlyBitSet())
13269      {
13270        commaAppend(keyUsageValue, "encipherOnly");
13271      }
13272
13273      if (keyUsage.isEncipherOnlyBitSet())
13274      {
13275        commaAppend(keyUsageValue, "decipherOnly");
13276      }
13277
13278      keytoolArguments.add("-ext");
13279      keytoolArguments.add("KeyUsage=" + keyUsageValue);
13280    }
13281
13282    if (extendedKeyUsage != null)
13283    {
13284      final StringBuilder extendedKeyUsageValue = new StringBuilder();
13285      for (final OID oid : extendedKeyUsage.getKeyPurposeIDs())
13286      {
13287        final ExtendedKeyUsageID id = ExtendedKeyUsageID.forOID(oid);
13288        if (id == null)
13289        {
13290          commaAppend(extendedKeyUsageValue, oid.toString());
13291        }
13292        else
13293        {
13294          switch (id)
13295          {
13296            case TLS_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION:
13297              commaAppend(extendedKeyUsageValue, "serverAuth");
13298              break;
13299            case TLS_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION:
13300              commaAppend(extendedKeyUsageValue, "clientAuth");
13301              break;
13302            case CODE_SIGNING:
13303              commaAppend(extendedKeyUsageValue, "codeSigning");
13304              break;
13305            case EMAIL_PROTECTION:
13306              commaAppend(extendedKeyUsageValue, "emailProtection");
13307              break;
13308            case TIME_STAMPING:
13309              commaAppend(extendedKeyUsageValue, "timeStamping");
13310              break;
13311            case OCSP_SIGNING:
13312              commaAppend(extendedKeyUsageValue, "OCSPSigning");
13313              break;
13314            default:
13315              // This should never happen.
13316              commaAppend(extendedKeyUsageValue, id.getOID().toString());
13317              break;
13318          }
13319        }
13320      }
13321
13322      keytoolArguments.add("-ext");
13323      keytoolArguments.add("ExtendedKeyUsage=" + extendedKeyUsageValue);
13324    }
13325
13326    if (! sanValues.isEmpty())
13327    {
13328      final StringBuilder subjectAltNameValue = new StringBuilder();
13329      for (final String sanValue : sanValues)
13330      {
13331        commaAppend(subjectAltNameValue, sanValue);
13332      }
13333
13334      keytoolArguments.add("-ext");
13335      keytoolArguments.add("SAN=" + subjectAltNameValue);
13336    }
13337
13338    if (! ianValues.isEmpty())
13339    {
13340      final StringBuilder issuerAltNameValue = new StringBuilder();
13341      for (final String ianValue : ianValues)
13342      {
13343        commaAppend(issuerAltNameValue, ianValue);
13344      }
13345
13346      keytoolArguments.add("-ext");
13347      keytoolArguments.add("IAN=" + issuerAltNameValue);
13348    }
13349
13350    for (final X509CertificateExtension e : genericExtensions)
13351    {
13352      keytoolArguments.add("-ext");
13353      if (e.isCritical())
13354      {
13355        keytoolArguments.add(e.getOID().toString() + ":critical=" +
13356             toColonDelimitedHex(e.getValue()));
13357      }
13358      else
13359      {
13360        keytoolArguments.add(e.getOID().toString() + '=' +
13361             toColonDelimitedHex(e.getValue()));
13362      }
13363    }
13364  }
13365
13366
13367
13368  /**
13369   * Appends the provided value to the given buffer.  If the buffer is not
13370   * empty, the new value will be preceded by a comma.  There will not be any
13371   * spaces on either side of the comma.
13372   *
13373   * @param  buffer  The buffer to which the value should be appended.
13374   * @param  value   The value to append to the buffer.
13375   */
13376  private static void commaAppend(@NotNull final StringBuilder buffer,
13377                                  @NotNull final String value)
13378  {
13379    if (buffer.length() > 0)
13380    {
13381      buffer.append(',');
13382    }
13383
13384    buffer.append(value);
13385  }
13386
13387
13388
13389  /**
13390   * Retrieves a set of information that may be used to generate example usage
13391   * information.  Each element in the returned map should consist of a map
13392   * between an example set of arguments and a string that describes the
13393   * behavior of the tool when invoked with that set of arguments.
13394   *
13395   * @return  A set of information that may be used to generate example usage
13396   *          information.  It may be {@code null} or empty if no example usage
13397   *          information is available.
13398   */
13399  @Override()
13400  @NotNull()
13401  public LinkedHashMap<String[],String> getExampleUsages()
13402  {
13403    final String keystorePath = getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "keystore");
13404    final String keystorePWPath =
13405         getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "keystore.pin");
13406    final String privateKeyPWPath =
13407         getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "server-cert-private-key.pin");
13408    final String exportCertOutputFile =
13409         getPlatformSpecificPath("server-cert.crt");
13410    final String exportKeyOutputFile =
13411         getPlatformSpecificPath("server-cert.private-key");
13412    final String genCSROutputFile = getPlatformSpecificPath("server-cert.csr");
13413    final String truststorePath =
13414         getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "truststore");
13415    final String truststorePWPath =
13416         getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "truststore.pin");
13417
13418    final LinkedHashMap<String[],String> examples =
13419         new LinkedHashMap<>(StaticUtils.computeMapCapacity(20));
13420
13421    examples.put(
13422         new String[]
13423         {
13424           "list-certificates",
13425           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13426           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13427           "--verbose",
13428           "--display-keytool-command"
13429         },
13430         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_LIST_1.get(keystorePath));
13431
13432    examples.put(
13433         new String[]
13434         {
13435           "export-certificate",
13436           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13437           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13438           "--alias", "server-cert",
13439           "--output-file", exportCertOutputFile,
13440           "--output-format", "PEM",
13441           "--verbose",
13442           "--display-keytool-command"
13443         },
13444         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_EXPORT_CERT_1.get(keystorePath,
13445              exportCertOutputFile));
13446
13447    examples.put(
13448         new String[]
13449         {
13450           "export-private-key",
13451           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13452           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13453           "--private-key-password-file", privateKeyPWPath,
13454           "--alias", "server-cert",
13455           "--output-file", exportKeyOutputFile,
13456           "--output-format", "PEM",
13457           "--verbose",
13458           "--display-keytool-command"
13459         },
13460         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_EXPORT_KEY_1.get(keystorePath,
13461              exportKeyOutputFile));
13462
13463    examples.put(
13464         new String[]
13465         {
13466           "import-certificate",
13467           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13468           "--keystore-type", "JKS",
13469           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13470           "--alias", "server-cert",
13471           "--certificate-file", exportCertOutputFile,
13472           "--private-key-file", exportKeyOutputFile,
13473           "--display-keytool-command"
13474         },
13475         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_IMPORT_1.get(exportCertOutputFile,
13476              exportKeyOutputFile, keystorePath));
13477
13478    examples.put(
13479         new String[]
13480         {
13481           "delete-certificate",
13482           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13483           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13484           "--alias", "server-cert"
13485         },
13486         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_DELETE_1.get(keystorePath));
13487
13488    examples.put(
13489         new String[]
13490         {
13491           "generate-self-signed-certificate",
13492           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13493           "--keystore-type", "PKCS12",
13494           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13495           "--alias", "ca-cert",
13496           "--subject-dn", "CN=Example Authority,O=Example Corporation,C=US",
13497           "--days-valid", "7300",
13498           "--validity-start-time", "20170101000000",
13499           "--key-algorithm", "RSA",
13500           "--key-size-bits", "4096",
13501           "--signature-algorithm", "SHA256withRSA",
13502           "--basic-constraints-is-ca", "true",
13503           "--key-usage", "key-cert-sign",
13504           "--key-usage", "crl-sign",
13505           "--display-keytool-command"
13506         },
13507         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_GEN_CERT_1.get(keystorePath));
13508
13509    examples.put(
13510         new String[]
13511         {
13512           "generate-certificate-signing-request",
13513           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13514           "--keystore-type", "PKCS12",
13515           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13516           "--output-file", genCSROutputFile,
13517           "--alias", "server-cert",
13518           "--subject-dn", "CN=ldap.example.com,O=Example Corporation,C=US",
13519           "--key-algorithm", "EC",
13520           "--key-size-bits", "256",
13521           "--signature-algorithm", "SHA256withECDSA",
13522           "--subject-alternative-name-dns", "ldap1.example.com",
13523           "--subject-alternative-name-dns", "ldap2.example.com",
13524           "--extended-key-usage", "server-auth",
13525           "--extended-key-usage", "client-auth",
13526           "--display-keytool-command"
13527         },
13528         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_GEN_CSR_1.get(keystorePath,
13529              genCSROutputFile));
13530
13531    examples.put(
13532         new String[]
13533         {
13534           "generate-certificate-signing-request",
13535           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13536           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13537           "--alias", "server-cert",
13538           "--use-existing-key-pair",
13539           "--inherit-extensions",
13540           "--display-keytool-command"
13541         },
13542         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_GEN_CSR_2.get(keystorePath));
13543
13544    examples.put(
13545         new String[]
13546         {
13547           "sign-certificate-signing-request",
13548           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13549           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13550           "--request-input-file", genCSROutputFile,
13551           "--certificate-output-file", exportCertOutputFile,
13552           "--alias", "ca-cert",
13553           "--days-valid", "730",
13554           "--include-requested-extensions",
13555           "--display-keytool-command"
13556         },
13557         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_SIGN_CERT_1.get(keystorePath,
13558              genCSROutputFile, exportCertOutputFile));
13559
13560    examples.put(
13561         new String[]
13562         {
13563           "change-certificate-alias",
13564           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13565           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13566           "--current-alias", "server-cert",
13567           "--new-alias", "server-certificate",
13568           "--display-keytool-command"
13569         },
13570         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_CHANGE_ALIAS_1.get(keystorePath,
13571              genCSROutputFile, exportCertOutputFile));
13572
13573    examples.put(
13574         new String[]
13575         {
13576           "change-keystore-password",
13577           "--keystore", getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "keystore"),
13578           "--current-keystore-password-file",
13579                getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "current.pin"),
13580           "--new-keystore-password-file",
13581                getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "new.pin"),
13582           "--display-keytool-command"
13583         },
13584         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_SC_CHANGE_KS_PW_EXAMPLE_1.get(
13585              getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "keystore"),
13586              getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "current.pin"),
13587              getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "new.pin")));
13588
13589    examples.put(
13590         new String[]
13591         {
13592           "retrieve-server-certificate",
13593           "--hostname", "ds.example.com",
13594           "--port", "636"
13595         },
13596         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_SC_RETRIEVE_CERT_EXAMPLE_1.get(
13597              getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "truststore")));
13598
13599    examples.put(
13600         new String[]
13601         {
13602           "copy-keystore",
13603           "--source-keystore",
13604                getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "keystore.jks"),
13605           "--source-keystore-password-file",
13606                getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "keystore.pin"),
13607           "--source-keystore-type", "JKS",
13608           "--destination-keystore",
13609                getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "keystore.p12"),
13610           "--destination-keystore-password-file",
13611                getPlatformSpecificPath("config", "keystore.pin"),
13612           "--destination-keystore-type", "PKCS12"
13613         },
13614         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_SC_COPY_KS_EXAMPLE_1.get("keystore.jks",
13615              "keystore.p12"));
13616
13617    examples.put(
13618         new String[]
13619         {
13620           "trust-server-certificate",
13621           "--hostname", "ldap.example.com",
13622           "--port", "636",
13623           "--keystore", truststorePath,
13624           "--keystore-password-file", truststorePWPath,
13625           "--alias", "ldap.example.com:636"
13626         },
13627         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_TRUST_SERVER_1.get(truststorePath));
13628
13629    examples.put(
13630         new String[]
13631         {
13632           "check-certificate-usability",
13633           "--keystore", keystorePath,
13634           "--keystore-password-file", keystorePWPath,
13635           "--alias", "server-cert"
13636         },
13637         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_CHECK_USABILITY_1.get(keystorePath));
13638
13639    examples.put(
13640         new String[]
13641         {
13642           "display-certificate-file",
13643           "--certificate-file", exportCertOutputFile,
13644           "--verbose",
13645           "--display-keytool-command"
13646         },
13647         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_DISPLAY_CERT_1.get(keystorePath));
13648
13649    examples.put(
13650         new String[]
13651         {
13652           "display-certificate-signing-request-file",
13653           "--certificate-signing-request-file", genCSROutputFile,
13654           "--display-keytool-command"
13655         },
13656         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_DISPLAY_CSR_1.get(keystorePath));
13657
13658    examples.put(
13659         new String[]
13660         {
13661           "--help-subcommands"
13662         },
13663         INFO_MANAGE_CERTS_EXAMPLE_HELP_SUBCOMMANDS_1.get(keystorePath));
13664
13665    return examples;
13666  }
13667}
